Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Unique, not like others”
Reviews.Author: rdekhkanov
Reviews.Content: The hotel is unique. Not like any others I've ever seen. To some it may be weird, but depends on how you look at it. I wouldn't recommend to for families with children at this hotel because there are some moniquens with different positions all around the lobby. The staff were very helpful and courteous. They have access to 3 beaches, but ask for a special paper at front desk. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great adorable fashion good location”
Reviews.Author: moumoune8120
Reviews.Content: A great and fashion hotel with a perfect location near the 5th avnue and beaches. Adorable personnel, so nice and always at your disposal. rooms are big, very clean and pleasant. All that you need. Bathroom is luxury and modern. Sweet breakfast just we need with a choice of various things Great access to beach clubs. Only little negative point : sometimes you can hear the music from the bar in your room but nothing so huge to disturb. perfect

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Fun Place”
Reviews.Author: 721Boston
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are older and stayed here for 15 nights. We were on the 2nd floor overlooking the street with a balcony in a Jr. Suite. The room was large and very nice. The bathroom was also a fine size with a great shower with always hot water and beautiful tiles. The breakfast was fine, but they need something more then just eggs. Music was played till late almost every night, but you know that before you stay there. . The roof top has seating and a shallow pool if you prefer rather then the beach, we went to the beach daily. We went to Kool Beach Club next door to Mamitas on 28th and the beach, a close walk. Only problem is at 1 they play loud techno house music and if you want silence forget it. A few nights some people that left the bar late were yelling to their friends and that woke us up. The darkening shades made it easier also to sleep. We slept well most of the nights and we are light sleepers. The management was really nice and Dave took care of anything we needed. They had beach towels for us and everything is really close by. I would stay here again and found it to be very reasonable since we did book it through Orbitz. So we did like this hotel very much and had a great time staying here.

Reviews.Title: “we highly recommend it to the in crowd”
Reviews.Author: mickrapa
Reviews.Content: This had been our second stay at this hotel and we highly recommend it to the in crowd. The staff at Reina are pro-active , very friendly, unpretentious, especially David Velazquez and manager Luis Hernandez who went out of their way to make us feel welcome.Our room was spacious well maintained with comfortable bed excellent AC and large modern bathroom. Breakfast Reina Rojas is wonderful as chef goes out of his way to make sure all are well fed. Roof top pool area with live DJs spinning chill music is just what you need after a long day at the beach or just walking around town. Definitely be back this winter if our finances permit :)

Reviews.Title: “Unique, party atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: pbpb2
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at this unique hotel. Location is great, right next to the 5th avenue and close to the beach. The staff was very helpful, polite and friendly : we had a problem with the water heater in our room and all the staff was very quick to find a solution for us, special thanks to David, manager who gave us an oustanding service! Rooms were clean and tidy, breakfast was good and the staff very nice and professionnal. Only downside to this hotel is the lack of sleep... It is indeed a party place, the bar close around 2am and the music plays very loud, plus the clients seems to be in a big party mood as well and were pretty noisy at night, If you don't mind catching on you sleep during daytime, this is a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Think twice before booking this place”
Reviews.Author: WChvrs
Reviews.Content: Up front WE DID NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL however we stayed at one within spitting distance from it and I don't see how anyone could get any sleep in that place. Our hotel was made of cinderblock and not directly attached to Reina Roja yet the thumping of bass could be felt until 3-4 am. Apparently the folks who run this place have no concept of being respectful of other people. Honestly, the place looked interesting but generally was dead. There was apparently a private party there a couple nights but even without people there they played loud music. I think they could have a chic, hip place if they would just tone it down a few notches.

Reviews.Title: “No way to sleep here!”
Reviews.Author: belgravia
Reviews.Content: How anyone can enjoy staying here is beyond me. It is so very noisy, all night long until 4AM music vibrates the entire building and it's surroundings. We would never choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Greatest stay in Playa del Carmen's most unique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Amelia B
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 5 nights and had a great time. The hotel is unique and stylish with very enticing architecture/decor, and the room was spacious, attractive and clean. The staff were very friendly and helpful with anything we needed including travel plans, since we are new to Playa del Carmen and were unsure of what to do during the day. The bar on the main floor has a great atmosphere and good music, and the rooftop patio has a beautiful pool with parties on Sundays where ladies get free drinks. The overall attitude of the place is very laid back, and we felt completely at home. This is a perfect place to stay if you want to enjoy the night life in Playa del Carmen - it is right in the centre of the main strip - just look for the glowing red building. The service is also great whether it be room service, the bar on the main floor, or the phenomenal breakfast that is also included in your stay. Overall, I would suggest this hotel to any fun-loving individual who also wants top quality and class.

Reviews.Title: “Hip and Stylish, beware the mosquitos”
Reviews.Author: Joe H
Reviews.Content: Overall my stay was fine, I will break it down to good and bad for easy reading: The Good, Hip and stylish. The whole hotel is decorated in reds and deep wood finishes. It looks really cool. They play DJ dance remixes throughout the public spaces during the day. At night they have live dj's playing the "lobby/bar" area. The main floor of the property is sprinkled with comfortable couches and beds. The staff is very friendly and accommodating. Most guests get the free breakfast which is fine for the money. Don't expect much, but it is fine. I had a jr. suite which was of good size. The bed was comfortable. The bathroom was a bit small, but ok. The best part of the room was the bath amenities of organic soaps and shampoos made with bee honey. Smelled great. And the mini bar filled with waters, juices, and lots of Red Bull (all free). Nice sized flat screen TV, but only 4 english speaking channels, but its Mexico and the networks are for the locals. Free wifi throughout the property was nice. Good views from the rooftop pool area. The bad: None of the red lights in my room worked and the maintenance guy could not fix them. No big deal as I probably would not have used them, but they should work. The pool on the roof which looks like a lap pool is actually only a foot deep for 3/4 and then only about 3 feet deep at the far 1/4 deep end. Bar on the roof only open when they have parties going on, but you can get drinks from the lobby bar and bring them to the roof yourself. On the weekends they have a rooftop party which is cool, but the music plays until 3am and the bass reverberates through the walls into your room. So unless you are up on the roof it can be hard to sleep. On the main floor the floor itself is actually elevated above a water feature that flows underneath and into small pools and fountains. Sounds great right? Well it wasn't working and was mostly drained and has become a mosquito breeding ground. I killed four mosquitos one evening as I sat and drank a beer and three more at breakfast. I have a ton of bites on my legs and arms. I did not see or swat a mosquito anywhere else in Playa del Carmen. General: The location is good, a few blocks from the beach. If you go to the beach go to Mamitas beach club. For a small fee you get a towel, lounge chair and umbrella. They have good food and service for all your needs with very clean bathrooms and a pool. The hotel is right off 5th avenue, the main tourist street with most restaurants and nightclubs. There are better hip hotels to choose from so if this hotel interests you please compare to Deseo, In Fashion, and Mosquito Blue. All are within the same area but are a bit nicer. Overall it was a good stay for the deal I got, but I could have picked better

Reviews.Title: “Tip 10% or else!”
Reviews.Content: While I didn't stay here I did visit the bar with a group of friends one evening. The bar was very cool with great touches such as the Xbox available to play and the pool and the mannequins. However it's a big place and apart from us there were no more than 10 other people there. We had two rounds of drinks, which were quite expensive for playa. We left a tip which equated to about 7% of the bill, mainly because we were out of change and small notes. As we left one of the waiters came up to us and said that the tip was no good because it was not enough. Yeah, we didn't feel like going back there again. Shame.

Reviews.Title: “hotel or night club”
Reviews.Author: reflections H
Reviews.Content: Great place, great design, great service, and great location. How ever the techno beat coming from the night club till 3 AM penetrates throuhout the building. If you are not a party person this is not the place to get a good nights rest.

Reviews.Title: “Fun and Fancy”
Reviews.Author: mamvalle
Reviews.Content: Unusual, sexy and chic. This design hotel is decorated with sex references, handcuffs, red lights and sex toys (!). Rooftop area turns out as a cool club at night. Rooms are thematic, but very confortable. Staff is educated and always ready to help you. Not sea-front, but at Playa del Carmen downtown area. I' ve written an article in NOVA Cosmopolitan magazine about it in 2010.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Stepho2689
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel! The rooms are great and the service is amazing! Everyone is kind and educated! I really recommend this place for young couples and groups looking for a great and fun place to stay while visiting beautiful playa del Carmen! Awesome congrats to everyone at Reina Roja! Only bad thing was restraint wasn't always open but its worth it!

Reviews.Title: “FUN AND AMAZING HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: OsheaSalame
Reviews.Content: In an overall view the hotel is very chic, exclusive, with a fun theme, i loved the customer service, just AMAZING AND DEDICATED people, the design is great and I loved the rooms, they are comfortable and spacious, the decoration, ornaments etc. One bad thing is that the restaurant does not open for lunch time, its a little problem if you`re not going out in the day. The pool is so cool and chic, I loved that part the most.

Reviews.Title: “A whole new experience”
Reviews.Author: BarbieMalibu007
Reviews.Content: This exotic hotel just a few blocks from the beach and right on 5th avenue, has an awesome design perfect for young couples looking to experience something different and exciting at a very accesible rate.The best atmosphere for party at the bar, a totally relaxing pool area at the rooftop and a variety of theme rooms to spice your vacation with luxure and fun perfectly balanced. My boyfriend and I had an amazing time and would come back for sure without hesitating. Staff is very friendly and helpfull they made me feel like a true queen.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay.”
Reviews.Author: megee333
Reviews.Content: Quirky hotel but very comfortable rooms and great service. Quiet and good location. Playa is a nice vacation spot, far better than Cancun.

Reviews.Title: ““Beautiful Hotel, Excellent Service, Definitely Met Our Expectations"”
Reviews.Author: mickrapa
Reviews.Content: “Beautiful Hotel, Excellent Service, Definitely Met Our Expectations" The Reina Roja is an excellent location at 5th and 20 ave within walking distance to all the restaurants, clubs and beach. This hotel has everything a 4star hotel should have, and more. The rooms are way more than you expect , clean, ultra modern decor but yet so romantic. Loved the flamboyant design of some theme rooms. The hotel is both surreal and trendy, the lobby area looks very alluring in it's red lighting . The decor in the hotel is better than any I have seen before and I cannot think of a hotel I have visited with such a style of its own. In the evening the lobby bars are a meeting point for the trendy Playa stylish people. The staff and service was superb . I was trying to find something to complain about, but I honestly could not find anything to complain about. We would come back to this hotel in a heart beat. Mick and Nancy Rapaport

Reviews.Title: “Horrible drinks- swear not a drop of alcohol in them.”
Reviews.Author: SpinnyBoss
Reviews.Content: It is really sad that in place like Mexico, where alcohol is so cheap, that a bar would serve a drink with no alcohol in it. My husband and I decided to try a ' Cosmo' and Long Island Ice Tea. My drink came in a 3 oz ( to the top) martini glass, so 1 oz of booze would have been noteworthy- nope not even the fake stuff to make you think you have drinking something. Both our drinks were 100% virgin or damn close. It's a neat looking place, and I resent paying $12 dollars for nothing but fruit juice!

Reviews.Title: “woken up to construction noise at the crack of dawn”
Reviews.Author: nativa_nyc
Reviews.Content: i work long hours and was so looking forward to a 2 night escape in playa del carmen, and a good nights sleep. the decor and concept of this place is well executed and perfect if you are looking for theme oriented hotel experience. the staff has generally been professional and warm, but we were really disappointed to be woken up to construction literally outside our door at 8am. i am usually an early riser but we were looking forward to to a slow relaxing morning and that is not posssible here. if i had not prepaid 2 nights, i'd be looking elswhere fora quiet room.

Reviews.Title: “Crass, tacky and just plain weird”
Reviews.Author: Chula_Banana
Reviews.Content: This place is just really strange. They bill the bar as an avant-garde concept hotel, but it falls totally flat. The mannequins dressed in bondage outfits, the dog bowls and the jail clashes badly with the sunburnt tourists in straw hats and the locals in the karaoke booths. None of it is authentic. Tries way too hard. I ended up with a greasy feeling. Needs heaps of class to save it, and better service from the waiters (one of whom did not want to give me my change until I promised him I'd leave him a tip. I know tourists can be cheap but if you want a classy joint you need smarter service). The hotel rooms are way overpriced, and although they are brand new and the pool is pretty swank, the weird bordello-vibe invades the whole place. Good only for people who have never been outside their town limits before and think its avant-garde.

Reviews.Title: “By far, the best room I've stayed in in Playa del Carmen"”
Reviews.Author: RoccoMiami
Reviews.Content: Reina Roja is by far the most distinctive hotel in Playa del Carmen, maybe in the whole Riviera Maya. Don't let the intense the red lights, the cages, the chains, fool you with a real dungeon. It's not. The lobby may be too crowded with furniture and other elements, but the hotel concept is fun an functional. The rooms have plenty of space, and everything WORKS: telephone, internet, TV, IPod station, quiet, etc. I don't want to comment on the price, I guess you take it,or you leave it. I strongly believe you'll get what you've been offered by Reina Roja

Reviews.Title: “a different take on leisure fun”
Reviews.Author: tvlbabe423
Reviews.Content: To be honest, I did not stay at this very new hotel, I just went to visit it as I was intrigued by it's look. But enjoyed tremendously what I saw. The main lobby area is open and shared with the restaurant/bar/lounge. The wood used to build the hotel is some of the prettiest wood I've seen! That combined with the comfortable chairs/sofas along with the metal cages and red lights makes for a truly unique experience. The rooms are equally as comfortable. I am looking forward to seeing the themed rooms once opened. The rooftop pool area is expansive. I love the pool. And the bar area at the pool that looked- to me- like the bow of a boat. The drinks/food are really good although some complained that food portions are small. The service was incredible! Some of the best service in Playa del Carmen. Prices on food/drink are very resonable. We expected higher from this style of place, but were happy to know we were wrong. I think everyone in my group of 20 was not sure what to expect when entering La Reina Roja. But all of us enjoyed ourselves and will come back soon!

HotelInfo.Name: Reina Roja Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Calle 20 No 128 | entre 5a v. y 10 Av., Playa del Carmen 77710, Mexico
